snippet: The law against consumption of alcohol in front of your apartment is enforced at police officers’ discretion, but the practice endures around the city.
abstract: New York City law against consumption of alcohol in front of homes is enforced at police officers’ discretion, but the practice endures across the five boroughs; New York Police Department issued 124,498 summons to people drinking on their stoops in 2011, a 'quality of life' violation that can carry a $25 fine, and a trip to criminal court (Series: Summer Nights).
lead_paragraph: The law against consumption of alcohol in front of your apartment is enforced at police officers’ discretion, but the practice endures around the city.

headline.seo: Drinking on Stoops Is Illegal in New York, but Popular
headline.main: Savoring the Illicit Thrill of a Glass of Something, Outside
headline.print_headline: Savoring the Illicit Thrill Of a Glass of Something, Outside
